headline.print_headline: A Calculated Deal In a Rate-Rigging Inquiry
headline.seo: In Barclays Inquiry, the Calculation in Making a Deal - Common Sense
headline.main: Calculated Deal in a Rate-Rigging Inquiry

docs.snippet: Barclays’ admitted efforts to manipulate the Libor appear to be a textbook case of white-collar financial crime, but it led to a nonprosecution agreement....
docs.abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column explores the Justice Department's decision not to prosecute Barclays for its involvement in the London interest-rate rigging scandal; contends that Barclays, which paid only a $450 million penalty, benefited from being the first bank to come forward and cooperate.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barclays’ admitted efforts to manipulate the Libor appear to be a textbook case of white-collar financial crime, but it led to a nonprosecution agreement.

headline.print_headline: American Withdraws After Positive Drug Test
headline.seo: U.S. Sprinter Debbie Dunn Withdraws After Positive Drug Test
headline.main: American Withdraws After Positive Drug Test

docs.snippet: Debbie Dunn, who was in the pool of runners for the 4x400-meter Olympic relay team at the Summer Games, has removed herself from the team....
docs.abstract: Debbie Dunn, sprinter who qualified for the United States Olympic track team, removes herself from the team after a positive drug test at the Olympic trials.
docs.lead_paragraph: Debbie Dunn, who was in the pool of runners for the 4x400-meter Olympic relay team at the Summer Games, has removed herself from the team.

headline.print_headline: Pac-12 and Big Ten Drop Scheduling Plan
headline.seo: Pac-12 and Big Ten Partnership Falls Apart
headline.main: Partnership Linking Pac-12 and Big Ten Falls Apart

docs.snippet: The leagues announced on Friday that an agreement for a full complement of football games between the conferences starting in 2017 had fizzled because of scheduling issues....
docs.abstract: Pacific-12 and Big Ten announce jointly that the proposed agreement for each of their members to play a football game against a team from the other conference starting in 2017 has fallen apart.
docs.lead_paragraph: The leagues announced on Friday that an agreement for a full complement of football games between the conferences starting in 2017 had fizzled because of scheduling issues.

headline.print_headline: Failing to Hit the Jackpot, and Hitting the Machine Instead
headline.seo: At Resorts World Casino, a Wave of Maimed Machines
headline.main: Failing to Hit Jackpot, and Hitting Machine Instead

docs.snippet: A crime wave of sorts is plaguing the Resorts World Casino in Queens: people attacking gambling machines....

keywords.value: Resorts World Casino New York City
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Police officers have become a familiar sight at the Resorts World Casino in Queens since it opened in 2011, but not for the kinds of crimes that had been predicted by opponents; police have arrested 41 people at the casino, accused of damaging its gambling machines after losing money; such demonstrations of slot and roulette rage are familiar to casino operators across the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: A crime wave of sorts is plaguing the Resorts World Casino in Queens: people attacking gambling machines.

headline.print_headline: 7 Officials in Afghan Investment Agency Quit, Protesting Graft
headline.seo: 7 Officials in Afghan Investment Agency Quit in Protest
headline.main: 7 Officials in Afghan Investment Agency Quit, Protesting Graft

docs.snippet: The seven members of the Afghanistan Investment Support Agency said there was rampant nepotism, corruption and mismanagement in the organization....
docs.abstract: Seven members of the Afghanistan Investment Support Agency, group that promotes investment in the country, resign, saying there is rampant nepotism, corruption and mismanagement within the organization; departures come just days after Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai assures the United States and international donors that he is serious about fighting corruption.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

docs.lead_paragraph: The seven members of the Afghanistan Investment Support Agency said there was rampant nepotism, corruption and mismanagement in the organization.

headline.print_headline: The Worst and the Best of America
headline.main: The Worst and the Best of America

docs.snippet: A group of friends, with origins from all over the world, celebrate the Fourth of July. One angry man threatens them. Another defends them. "These are my people, too," he says....
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of friends, with origins from all over the world, celebrate the Fourth of July. One angry man threatens them. Another defends them. "These are my people, too," he says.

headline.print_headline: Chelsea’s Terry Is Acquitted of Racially Abusing Player
headline.seo: Soccer Star Acquitted in British Trial Over Racial Slur
headline.main: Soccer Star Acquitted in British Trial Over Racial Slur

docs.snippet: John Terry was acquitted of racially abusing an opposing player, Anton Ferdinand, in an unusual case that provided a vivid window into what happens on the field in British Premier League soccer games....
docs.abstract: Chelsea soccer star John Terry is acquitted of racially abusing Queens Park Rangers opponent Anton Ferdinand, in an unusual case that provides a vivid window into what happens on the field in British Premier League soccer games.
docs.lead_paragraph: John Terry was acquitted of racially abusing an opposing player, Anton Ferdinand, in an unusual case that provided a vivid window into what happens on the field in British Premier League soccer games.

headline.print_headline: Building Loyalty With Bricks and Mortar
headline.seo: In Venezuela, a Campaigning Chávez Builds Loyalty With House Giveaways

docs.snippet: On a live national broadcast each week, President Hugo Chávez, who is running for re-election, presents new dwellings to down-on-their-luck Venezuelans....
docs.abstract: Venezuela's Pres Hugo Chavez maintains popular support, despite rampant crime, erratic basic services and stubborn poverty, with his housing giveaways financed by the country's vast oil income; Chavez, who is running for re-election, promotes the giveaways through the Housing Thursday broadcasts and television commercials that are essentially government-paid ads for his candidacy.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

docs.lead_paragraph: On a live national broadcast each week, President Hugo Chávez, who is running for re-election, presents new dwellings to down-on-their-luck Venezuelans.

headline.print_headline: A Refuge So Quiet, God’s Whisper Can Be Heard
headline.seo: A Refuge Silent Enough to Hear God’s Whisper: On Religion
headline.main: A Refuge Silent Enough to Hear God’s Whisper

docs.snippet: Retreats at the monastery of the Society of Saint John the Evangelist provide a contemplative, prayerful respite from the cacophony of the secular world....
docs.abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column observes that the monastery of the Society of Saint John the Evangelist, located in Cambridge, Mass, offers retreats for those who want a contemplative, prayerful respite from the cacophony of the secular world.
docs.lead_paragraph: Retreats at the monastery of the Society of Saint John the Evangelist provide a contemplative, prayerful respite from the cacophony of the secular world.

headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Shares Ignite Rally, Ending a 6-Day Losing Streak
headline.seo: Big Gains at JPMorgan Strengthen Outlook on Banking Sector
headline.main: JPMorgan Shares Ignite Rally, Ending a 6-Day Losing Streak

docs.snippet: The country’s largest bank earned $5 billion in the last quarter, easily beating forecasts, despite a deeper loss from a trade that went wrong....
docs.abstract: Jump in JPMorgan shares blows away a cloud of concern hanging over the banking industry and sets off a rally in stocks, ending a six-day losing streak for the market.
docs.lead_paragraph: The country’s largest bank earned $5 billion in the last quarter, easily beating forecasts, despite a deeper loss from a trade that went wrong.
